ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Be very afraid....
ygData.msgSnippet: Time was the only factor for me.  No loot arguing in AL, it s very nice. I think once you have a kid, that s the beginning of the end.  Either quitting, or
ygData.messageBody:
Time was the only factor for me. No loot arguing in AL, it's very nice.
I think once you have a kid, that's the beginning of the end. Either
quitting, or playing casual. Plus the reason I played so much from
51-59 was because of RL problems, once the RL problems ended is when I
quit. Now that they are not only gone but better, I am definitely
staying casual.

Shaisi (lol)

-----Original Message-----
From: Cranfill, Wendy [mailto:Wendy_Cranfill@...]
Sent: Friday, August 24, 2001 9:57 AM
To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Be very afraid....


No problem at all Shaisi :P
Sometimes it makes me laugh at how worked up ALL of us get over a game.
Personally, I'm a little jealous that you broke out of the never ending
guild raids etc. I'm getting a little fed up.. sure its fun doing "new"
things but is it really worth it to spend EVERY WAKING MOMENT online at
huge
raids listening to 15 year olds (and 30 year olds) argue about loot?

Hmm sounding a little bitter aren't I?
